Container.Name: Sharry
Container.Overview:
Sharry allows to share files with others in a simple way. It is a self-hosted web application. The basic concept is: upload files and get a url back that can then be shared.
Being based on Alpine Linux, size of this container is very small.
For a complete documentation of this container, see https://github.com/jlesage/docker-sharry#readme

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: This is where the application stores its configuration, states, log and any files needing persistency.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Umask
Config.Description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

Config.Name: Niceness (priority)
Config.Description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority. NOTE: Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, "--cap-add=SYS_NICE" must be added to Extra Parameters (shown when Advanced View is enabled).

Config.Name: External URL
Config.Description: The external URL where Sharry can be reached (e.g. "https://sharry.example.com"). This is used to create absolute URLs and to configure the authentication cookie. These URLs are sent to the client, so they must resolve back to the Sharry server. If the default value is used, the external URL is obtained dynamically by inspecting HTTP headers of the request.

Config.Name: Admin Account Username
Config.Description: Username of the built-in administrator account. Setting this variable to an empty value disables this account.

Config.Name: Admin Account Password
Config.Description: Password of the built-in administrator account. Setting this variable to an empty value disables this account.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port used to access the web interface of the application. NOTE: This setting is relevant only when the Network Type is set to "Bridge".
